title: 256: Atheism and the Well-Lived Life
itunes:author: Philosophy Talk Starters
itunes:summary:
More at http://philosophytalk.org/shows/atheism-and-well-lived-life.

Atheists don't believe in God – does that mean they don't find life meaningful?  Are atheists doomed to be grouchy nihilists, finding meaning only in criticizing theists?  Or does a world without God offer its own meanings and values to structure a well-lived life?  John and Ken search for a meaningful atheism with Louise Antony from UMass Amherst, editor of "Philosophers Without Gods: Meditations on Atheism and the Secular Life."
itunes:subtitle: More at http://philosophytalk.org/shows/atheism-a…
